page.title: 18THE IDEAL STUD FARM
page.content:
A stud farm needs to be in a quiet
and peaceful area. The paddocks should be sheltered by hedges or belts of trees and most important of all, the grass should grow well.{Hare Park}Stud Farm has all of these things. The grass that grows on the chalk soils around Newmarket is particularly good and nutritious for the rearing of foals as it contains calcium. The paddocks at the stud farm have been left unsrapayed, no weedkillers or top-dressings of chemical fertiliser are used. The meadows contain many wild plants and herbs. The situation of the farm in close proximity to trunk roads (A11, A45, and M11) only adds to its attractiveness as a stud.
